column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=The Secretary-General: The women and peace\r
#Text=and security agenda is clearly one of the top priorities\r
#Text=of the United Nations as a whole.
#Text=We see that in the\r
#Text=adoption of a great many resolutions by the Security\r
#Text=Council, including landmark resolution 1325 (2000)\r
#Text=and its many follow-up decisions.
#Text=We see it in the global\r
#Text=recognition of the central role that women must play in\r
#Text=preventing and resolving conflicts.
#Text=And we see it when\r
#Text=we gather to discuss the issue.
#Text=That is always when the\r
#Text=Chamber is at its fullest and the list of speakers is the\r
#Text=longest.
#Text=We have exactly that same situation today.
#Text=Given such strong support and common\r
#Text=understanding, an observer might be forgiven for\r
#Text=thinking that things are substantially improving.
#Text=But\r
#Text=the sad fact is - and we must be blunt about it - that\r
#Text=the commitment that is always reflected around this\r
#Text=table is not translating into real change around the\r
#Text=world.
#Text=It is not coming fast enough or far enough.
#Text=Change is coming at a pace that is too slow for the\r
#Text=women and girls whose lives depend on it, and for the\r
#Text=effectiveness of our efforts to maintain international\r
#Text=peace and security.
#Text=Nearly two decades after resolution 1325 (2000)\r
#Text=was adopted, women still face exclusion from many\r
#Text=peace and political processes.
#Text=Peace agreements are\r
#Text=adopted without provisions that consider the needs and\r
#Text=priorities of women and girls.
#Text=A pitifully small 0.2 per\r
#Text=cent of bilateral aid to fragile and conflict-affected\r
#Text=situations goes to women's organizations.
#Text=The number\r
#Text=of attacks against women human rights defenders,\r
#Text=humanitarians and peacebuilders continues to increase.
#Text=Sexual and gender-based violence continues to be\r
#Text=used as a weapon of war, with the survivors of such\r
#Text=violence often left without justice or support.
#Text=This year\r
#Text=alone, millions of women and girls were in need of\r
#Text=life-saving sexual and reproductive health services, and\r
#Text=millions more required interventions to prevent sexual\r
#Text=and gender-based violence.
#Text=There is also a growing\r
#Text=number of armed groups for which gender inequality\r
#Text=is a strategic objective, and misogyny part of their core\r
#Text=ideology.
#Text=And, of course, we know that women and\r
#Text=girls continue to suffer the consequences of conflict in\r
#Text=general.
#Text=To cite just one example, in north-east Syria,\r
#Text=we saw thousands of women and children fleeing the\r
#Text=latest violence.
#Text=But despite this grim litany, we will not\r
#Text=give up.
#Text=This, for me, is an absolute priority.
#Text=We can report at least some progress.
#Text=In Yemen,\r
#Text=where women were absent from the formal rounds\r
#Text=of consultations, my Special Envoy established a\r
#Text=Yemeni women's technical advisory group to ensure\r
#Text=that the perspectives of Yemeni women are included.
#Text=In Guinea-Bissau, women played a direct role in\r
#Text=breaking the political impasse last year, supported\r
#Text=by the Peacebuilding Fund.
#Text=They led unprecedented\r
#Text=mobilization for parity laws requiring a minimum of\r
#Text=36 per cent of women on the ballot, and they were key\r
#Text=to the success of the elections this year.
#Text=There were\r
#Text=record numbers of women candidates and voters, and\r
#Text=the country achieved parity among ministerial posts.
#Text=In\r
#Text=Syria, women make up approximately 30 per cent ofthe\r
#Text=new Constitutional Committee, including some from\r
#Text=the Women's Advisory Board that has been working for\r
#Text=peace all these years.
#Text=Within the United Nations itself, the Department of\r
#Text=Political and Peacebuilding Affairs and the Department\r
#Text=of Peace Operations are implementing a new and stronger\r
#Text=policy on women and peace and security.
#Text=All heads of\r
#Text=special political missions and my Special Envoys have\r
#Text=\r
#Text=been instructed to report regularly on their efforts to\r
#Text=promote women's direct participation throughout all\r
#Text=stages of peace processes, in ways that ensure they have\r
#Text=influence over the outcomes.
#Text=An objective related to\r
#Text=women and peace and security has now been included\r
#Text=in all senior managers' compacts related to peace and\r
#Text=security mandates.
#Text=In our peacekeeping operations, we\r
#Text=are working to end sexual exploitation and abuse and\r
#Text=increase women's participation.
#Text=Incidents of sexual\r
#Text=exploitation and abuse have been reduced by half, and\r
#Text=we are finally moving the needle on the percentage of\r
#Text=women in the military and the police components of\r
#Text=our operations.
#Text=I have appointed many more women as\r
#Text=heads and deputy heads of missions, and we are pursuing\r
#Text=emergency measures to achieve gender balance.
#Text=Women and peace and security is one of the\r
#Text=eight priority pillars of our Action for Peacekeeping\r
#Text=initiative, endorsed now by more than 150 countries.
#Text=I\r
#Text=have also requested peacekeeping and special political\r
#Text=missions to improve their monitoring and reporting of\r
#Text=threats and violence against activists, including women\r
#Text=human rights defenders, and for that to be built into\r
#Text=early warning signs of escalating conflict or instability.
#Text=Without a gender analysis, we are operating on partial\r
#Text=information and are unable to anticipate and respond\r
#Text=effectively to early warnings.
#Text=Today we recognize both progress and how much\r
#Text=more we must do.
#Text=When we fall short, women, girls\r
#Text=and all members of society suffer the consequences.
#Text=A\r
#Text=failure to act on women's rights and the principles of\r
#Text=the women and peace and security agenda bring about\r
#Text=enormous costs.
#Text=Let us work together to change the\r
#Text=narrative and improve, through implementation, the\r
#Text=situation on the ground.
